content.description: The graph shows the cost and revenue curves for a profit-maximizing monopolist that produces teddy bears. The letters in the graph represent the enclosed areas.
content.question: If the monopolist engages in perfect price discrimination, which of the following will happen?

choices.label: Consumer surplus will remain the same <math alttext="(a, plus b)" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mstyle><mrow><mtext>a</mtext><mo>+</mo><mtext>b</mtext></mrow></mstyle><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math> and producer surplus will increase by area <math alttext="(e)" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mstyle><mrow><mtext>e</mtext></mrow></mstyle><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math>.

Both consumer surplus and producer surplus will decrease by area <math alttext="(a, plus b, plus c, plus d)" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mstyle><mrow><mtext>a</mtext><mo>+</mo><mtext>b</mtext><mo>+</mo><mtext>c</mtext><mo>+</mo><mtext>d</mtext></mrow></mstyle><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math>, and the deadweight loss will remain constant.

Consumer surplus will increase by area <math alttext="(e)" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mstyle><mrow><mtext>e</mtext></mrow></mstyle><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math>, producer surplus will decrease by area <math alttext="(e)" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mrow><mo>(</mo><mstyle><mrow><mtext>e</mtext></mrow></mstyle><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></math>, and the deadweight loss will be zero.
Consumer surplus and deadweight loss will be zero because all economic surplus will be transferred to producer surplus.

Both consumer surplus and producer surplus will increase because output produced will increase to <math alttext="Q sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Q</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: Consumer surplus and deadweight loss will be zero because all economic surplus will be transferred to producer surplus.
